sourceText: Annual Survey of Hours and Earnings - 2015, ONS
fact: The shape of earnings prior to and  immediately after the introduction  of the National Minimum Wage  (in 1999) was smooth.

From 2005 onwards a kink begins  to develop in the distribution  around the National Minimum Wage,  with a growing number of jobs paying  the statutory minumun per hour.

This trend continues both during and  following the economic downturn of  2008 to 2009. By 2015, 8% of employee  jobs paid at,or up to 40p above,  National Minimum Wage hourly rate.
